intro: Tarenna pavettoides subsp. friesiorum, commonly known as the Friesii tarenna, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite, and often glandular leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by small, woody fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
